oai_dc:dc.dc:title: (40)A-Ar-39 age of a lava flow from the bhimashankar formation, Giravali ghat, Deccan Traps
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PANDE, K
PATTANAYAK, SK
SUBBARAO, KV
NAVANEETHAKRISHNAN, P
VENKATESAN, TR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cretaceous tertiary boundary
india
volcanism
basalts
standards
deccan volcanism
ar-ar dating
cretaceous-tertiary boundary
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We report here a Ar-40-Ar-39 age of 66.0 +/- 0.9 Ma (2sigma) for a reversely magnetised tholeiitic lava flow from the Bhimashankar Formation (Fm.), Giravali Ghat, western Deccan province, India. This age is consistent with the view that the 1.8-2 km thick bottom part of the exposed basalt flow sequence in the Western Ghats was extruded very close to 67.4 Ma.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PROCEEDINGS OF THE INDIAN ACADEMY OF SCIENCES-EARTH AND PLANETARY SCIENCES, 113(4), 755-758
